prompt:
You are a helpful assistant for causal reasoning. Which cause-and-effect relationship is more likely?

A. changing <Var1>Variable 1</Var1> causes a change in <Var2>Variable 2</Var2>.
B. changing <Var2>Variable 2</Var2> causes a change in <Var1>Variable 1</Var1>.

Definitions:
<Var1>Variable 1</Var1>: <Definition1>Definition 1</Definition1>.
<Var2>Variable 2</Var2>: <Definition2>Definition 2</Definition2>.

Let's work this out in a step by step way to be sure that we have the right answer. Then provide your final answer within the tags <Answer>A/B</Answer>.
